alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains due to slow moving thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from these storms during the last hour. Public reported ankle deep water in the Sawgrass mills mall parking lot from the heavy rains. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours from the slow moving storms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Lauderhill and Sawgrass Mills Mall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
